negativeEvents.name: Car Accident
negativeEvents.text: You have gotten into a car accident, that has left your car completely damaged! How will you handle this terrible situation?

counteractions.name: Replace the car, and buy a new car that costs $15,000
Damages will cost you $8,000 in repairs.
Use your auto-insurance to get the damages fixed.

negativeEvents.name: Medical Emergency
negativeEvents.text: You just found out that your daughter slipped off the road, while driving, and hit a tree. She is in stable condition, but you are now filled with hospital fees. What do you do now?

counteractions.name: You have health insurance!
Save your health insurance and pay out of pocket instead. Payment would be $1,050.
You do not believe that the health insurance will cover the entire medical fees. Take out a loan that is worth $1,050.

negativeEvents.name: You're Fired!
negativeEvents.text: You have just been laid off! Hopefully, you have a backup plan for a situation like this.

counteractions.name: You will find a job soon, so use the money you saved to get by. Use $2,000 from savings account.
Take out a loan of $3,500. You do not know when you will find another job.
You have a severance package worth $1,500. Add $1,500 to your account.

negativeEvents.name: Parents Can Become Sick Too!
negativeEvents.text: Your mother has been very sick recently. She has been in and out of the hospital all week. Since she does not have any insurance, her bills are extremely expensive. You need to do something.

counteractions.name: No need in using the health insurance. You have enough money, so you can pay $3,500.
Your health insurance plan, should be able to cover the most of the costs. You will still have to pay $600.
Go on a payment plan. Pay $175 a month for 20 months.

negativeEvents.name: The Robbery
negativeEvents.text: You have been ROBBED! Your most valuable possessions were taken, did you have everything covered?

counteractions.name: You do not have health insurance. So the damages will cost you $4,025.
Take out a loan for $4,025.
Use your home insurance to cover the damages of your home.

positiveEvents.name: Your Bonus Check!
positiveEvents.text: You have just gotten a 10% bonus from work. How will you handle the extra money you have just recieved?

counteractions.name: Add the bonus to your checkings account.
Add the bonus to your savings account.
Add half the bonus to your checkings and savings account.

positiveEvents.name: Charity
positiveEvents.text: Your favorite charity needs money raised to supply those who are in need with some regular day by day supplies in order to live. You know you would feel bad if you did not do anything to help. So, how will you help them out?

counteractions.name: Go into your savings account and donate $500.
Go into your checkings account and donate $500.
Keep your money and donate next time.

positiveEvents.name: Graduation Day
positiveEvents.text: You just graduated from college, and you now need to figure out your financial plan.

counteractions.name: Begin using life insurance.
File for health insurance.
Spend $15,000 for a brand new car.

positiveEvents.name: Your Very Own Business
positiveEvents.text: Your sibiling has been telling you about a great opportunity that they had in mind. They want to start a business with you, and is asking that you put up the start up money. A new business adventure can be a great opportunity for you. So what will you do?

counteractions.name: Turn down the opportunity. You just don't have it right now.
Take out a loan and give $6000 to help start the business.
Spend $6000 to help start the business.

positiveEvents.name: New Born Baby
positiveEvents.text: You have just witness the birth of your new adorable baby boy! He already bringing you a lot of joy into your life, but what if something happens?

counteractions.name: Recieve health insurance.
You have everything that you need, and your new baby will be just fine.
Put $1,000 into your savings account.
